item.title: 特朗普警告欧盟征收报复性关税，称爱尔兰税收政策吸引美国企业
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周三誓言要回应欧盟的威胁，即在特朗普对进口钢铁和铝实施全面关税后，欧盟将从下月起对价值260亿欧元（280亿美元）的美国商品征收反关税。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday vowed to respond to the European Union's threat to impose counter tariffs on 26 billion euros ($28 billion) worth of U.S. goods from next month after Trump implemented blanket tariffs on steel and aluminum imports.】

item.title: 特朗普警告欧盟征收报复性关税，称爱尔兰税收政策吸引美国企业
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周三誓言要回应欧盟的威胁，即在特朗普对进口钢铁和铝实施全面关税后，欧盟将从下月起对价值260亿欧元（280亿美元）的美国商品征收反关税。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday vowed to respond to the European Union's threat to impose counter tariffs on 26 billion euros ($28 billion) worth of U.S. goods from next month after Trump implemented blanket tariffs on steel and aluminum imports.】

item.title: 摩根大通下调特斯拉目标股价，券商预计交付量将减少
item.description: 摩根大通（J.P.Morgan）下调了特斯拉的目标股价，因为该券商预计特斯拉的交付量将连续第二年下降，分析师还指出，现有客户和潜在的新买家对这家电动汽车制造商的看法发生了变化。【原文：J.P.Morgan cut its price target on Tesla's stock as the brokerage expects a second straight year of lower deliveries, with analysts also pointing to a change in sentiment toward the EV maker from existing customers and potential new buyers.】

item.title: 美国联邦贸易委员会因 "资源严重不足 "要求推迟亚马逊审判
item.description: 本周三，美国联邦贸易委员会以 "资金和人员严重短缺 "为由，要求西雅图联邦法院推迟 9 月份对亚马逊在其 Prime 订阅服务上误导消费者一案的审理。【原文：The U.S. Federal Trade Commission asked a federal court in Seattle to delay a September trial in its case alleging Amazon misled consumers over its Prime subscription service, citing "severe resource shortfalls in terms of both money and personnel," on Wednesday.】

item.title: 银行气候联盟主席表示，该联盟寻求全面修订规则
item.description: 世界领先的银行业气候联盟主席告诉路透社记者，在一些最大的银行退出后，该联盟正在就修改其规则向其成员征求意见。【原文：The world's leading climate coalition for the banking sector is canvassing members over changes to its rules, its chair told Reuters, following the withdrawal of some of the biggest banks and as the real economy falls short of more ambitious climate action.】

item.title: TC 能源公司首席执行官表示，尽管贸易关系紧张，但公司仍看好美国市场
item.description: 加拿大管道公司TC Energy Corp.首席执行官表示，在资本投资方面，该公司继续倾向于美国而非加拿大，即使两国之间的贸易紧张局势不断升级。【原文：The CEO of Canadian pipeline company TC Energy Corp. said it continues to favor the U.S. over Canada when it comes to capital investment, even as trade tensions between the two countries escalate.】

item.title: 意大利在审查意大利联合信贷银行对 BPM 的竞购时发出了 "宽松 "信号
item.description: 意大利经济部长吉安卡洛-乔盖蒂（Giancarlo Giorgetti）周三表示，意大利打算以合理的方式行使其干预意大利联合信贷银行（UniCredit）竞购 Banco BPM 的权利，似乎排除了对该交易采取强硬态度的可能性。【原文：Italy intends to use its right to intervene on UniCredit's bid for Banco BPM in a reasonable manner, Economy Minister Giancarlo Giorgetti said on Wednesday, appearing to rule out a hardline approach to the deal.】

item.title: 史密斯菲尔德食品公司首席执行官：关税使猪肉业务更加复杂
item.description: 关税 美国最大的猪肉加工商史密斯菲尔德食品公司（Smithfield Foods）首席执行官谢恩-史密斯（Shane Smith）周三表示，关税使该公司出售猪的所有部位变得更加复杂。【原文：Tariffs make it more complicated for Smithfield Foods , the biggest U.S. pork processor, to sell all parts of a pig, CEO Shane Smith said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 阿根廷 2 月份通胀率略有上升：路透社民意调查
item.description: 路透社在周五公布数据前对分析师进行的调查显示，阿根廷 2 月份的月通胀率可能有所上升，略高于 1 月份的数字。【原文：Argentina's monthly inflation rate likely rose in February, slightly higher than the figure recorded in January, a Reuters poll of analysts showed ahead of data due on Friday.】

item.title: 英国法院裁定，巴里克公司必须就兰德戈德公司并购案向交易商汉纳姆公司支付 200 万美元
item.description: 伦敦高等法院周三裁定，加拿大巴里克黄金公司（Barrick Gold）必须向英国交易商伊恩-汉纳姆（Ian Hannam）的公司支付 200 万美元，外加他在收购金矿商兰德戈德资源公司（Randgold Resources）过程中的费用。【原文：Canada's Barrick Gold must pay British dealmaker Ian Hannam's firm $2 million plus expenses for his work on the acquisition of gold miner Randgold Resources, London's High Court ruled on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国需求强劲，巴西鸡蛋出口飙升
item.description: 巴西动物蛋白协会（ABPA）周三称，2月份巴西鸡蛋出口（包括新鲜鸡蛋和加工产品）增长了57.5%，原因是美国需求强劲。【原文：Brazilian egg exports, including fresh and processed products, increased by 57.5% in February, the Brazilian Animal Protein Association (ABPA) said on Wednesday, citing stronger U.S. demand.】

item.title: 运动鞋制造商金鹅去年净收入增长 13
item.description: 意大利奢侈运动鞋制造商金鹅公司（Golden Goose）去年净收入增长了 13%，达到 6.55 亿欧元（约合 7.15 亿美元），这得益于 24 家新店的开张。【原文：Italian luxury sneaker maker Golden Goose reported a 13% increase in net revenues last year to 655 million euros ($715 million), helped by 24 new store openings.】

item.title: 关税生效，美国铝价和钢价在峰值附近徘徊
item.description: 在美国 25% 的关税生效并引发加拿大和欧洲的报复之后，美国的铝和钢成本周三在近期峰值附近徘徊。【原文：The cost of aluminium and steel in the United States hovered near recent peaks on Wednesday after U.S. tariffs of 25% took effect and sparked retaliation from Canada and Europe.】

item.title: 加密货币交易所 Binance 获得阿布扎比 MGX 20 亿美元投资
item.description: 阿布扎比投资集团 MGX 向 Binance 投资了价值 20 亿美元的加密货币，这家全球最大的加密货币交易所周三表示，这是其首次机构投资。【原文：Abu Dhabi investment group MGX has invested $2 billion worth of cryptocurrency into Binance, in what the world's largest cryptocurrency exchange said on Wednesday was its first institutional investment.】

item.title: Northvolt 破产对瑞典北部繁荣城市造成打击
item.description: 电池制造商 Northvolt 曾是瑞典绿色工业繁荣的领头羊，它的破产对瑞典北部，尤其是小镇 Skelleftea 造成了巨大打击。【原文：The bankruptcy of battery cell maker Northvolt, once the leader of Sweden's green industrial boom, is a huge blow to the country's north and particularly the small town of Skelleftea.】

item.title: 俄罗斯央行建议允许富人投资加密货币
item.description: 俄罗斯央行周三表示，已提议对富人的某些加密货币投资进行监管，并概述了 "特别合格 "投资者交易加密资产的计划。【原文：Russia's central bank has proposed regulating certain cryptocurrency investments for wealthy individuals, it said on Wednesday, outlining plans for "specially qualified" investors to trade crypto assets.】

item.title: 谷歌为快速发展的机器人产业推出新的人工智能模型
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司周三在其双子座 2.0 模型的基础上推出了两款为机器人应用量身定制的新人工智能模型，以迎合快速增长的机器人产业。【原文：Alphabet's Google launched two new AI models tailored for robotics applications on Wednesday based on its Gemini 2.0 model, as it looks to cater to the rapidly growing robotics industry.】

item.title: 波兰希望特朗普撤销拜登时代的人工智能芯片限制措施
item.description: 波兰数字部副部长达柳什-斯坦德尔斯基（Dariusz Standerski）周三表示，特朗普政府可能会取消对波兰使用美国设计的人工智能芯片的限制。【原文：Restrictions on Poland's access to the U.S.-designed AI chips may be lifted by the Trump administration, Polish deputy digital minister Dariusz Standerski said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 科技并购咨询公司 AXOM 聘请摩根士丹利的 Black 负责软件交易
item.description: 专注于技术领域的精品咨询公司 AXOM Partners 已从摩根士丹利聘请了投资银行家 Buzz Black，以加强对企业软件行业的覆盖。【原文：AXOM Partners, a technology-focused boutique advisory firm, has hired investment banker Buzz Black from Morgan Stanley, as it looks to strengthen its coverage of the enterprise software industry.】

item.title: 部长称巴西不会立即对美国钢铁关税采取报复措施
item.description: 巴西财政部长费尔南多-哈达德（Fernando Haddad）周三表示，南美国家不会立即对美国征收的钢铝进口关税进行报复，而是寻求谈判。【原文：Brazil's Finance Minister Fernando Haddad said on Wednesday that the South American country would not immediately retaliate against tariffs imposed by the United States on steel and aluminum imports, instead seeking negotiations.】

item.title: 花旗任命 Chris Cox 为投资者服务主管
item.description: 花旗集团已任命 Chris Cox 为投资者服务部主管，负责该华尔街巨头的托管、基金服务和执行服务业务。【原文：Citi has appointed Chris Cox as head of Investor Services, with responsibility for the custody, fund services and execution services businesses at the Wall Street giant, where a sweeping reorganisation of staff and structure continues.】

item.title: 业界称欧盟关税将对烈酒行业造成 "毁灭性 "打击
item.description: 大西洋两岸的贸易协会周三表示，欧盟对波旁威士忌等美国烈酒征收关税将对酒类行业造成 "毁灭性 "打击。【原文：European Union tariffs affecting U.S. spirits like bourbon whiskey will be "devastating" for the liquor industry, trade associations on both sides of the Atlantic said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国商务部长表示不会停止征收金属关税，将增加铜保护措施
item.description: 美国商务部长霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）表示，在美国国内生产得到加强之前，任何措施都无法阻止唐纳德-特朗普总统扩大征收25%的钢铝关税，而且特朗普将在其贸易保护措施中加入铜。【原文：U.S. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said nothing would stop President Donald Trump's expanded 25% tariffs on steel and aluminum until U.S. domestic production is strengthened, and that Trump will add copper to his trade protections.】

item.title: 独家报道：消息人士称，Blackstone 正在评估 Reese Witherspoon 的《Hello Sunshine》的选择方案
item.description: 四位熟悉此事的人士告诉路透社，Blackstone 正在为其好莱坞媒体公司 Candle Media 投资组合中最知名的资产之一 Hello Sunshine 探索各种选择，包括将其与另一家公司合并的可能性。【原文：Blackstone is exploring options for Hello Sunshine, one of the best-known assets in the portfolio of its Hollywood media company, Candle Media, including the possibility of combining it with another company, four people familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 莱茵金属首席执行官：大众奥斯纳布吕克工厂 "非常适合 "国防生产
item.description: 德国莱茵金属公司（Rheinmetall）首席执行官周三表示，大众汽车位于奥斯纳布吕克的工厂非常适合转为军工生产，这家德国汽车制造商正在考虑如何重新利用该工厂，其中可能包括出售。【原文：Volkswagen's factory in Osnabrueck would be a good fit for a conversion to military production, the CEO of Rheinmetall said on Wednesday, as the German carmaker considers ways to repurpose the site that could include a sale.】

item.title: 欧盟瞄准牙线和钻石以对抗美国关税
item.description: 从牙线到钻石，从浴袍到波旁威士忌，欧盟下月选择征收反关税的美国产品旨在让共和党投票州的工人和企业质疑美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的贸易政策。【原文：From dental floss to diamonds, bathrobes to bourbon, the U.S. products chosen by the European Union for counter-tariffs next month are designed to make workers in Republican-voting states and businesses questions U.S. President Donald Trump's trade policy.】

item.title: 英国反垄断机构对苹果和谷歌的移动浏览器表示担忧
item.description: 英国反垄断监管机构称，其调查小组发现，由苹果和谷歌主导的移动浏览器市场对消费者和企业来说并不理想，这支持了其今年 1 月对该行业展开调查的决定。【原文：Britain's antitrust regulator said its inquiry group had found the mobile browser market, dominated by Apple and Google, was not working well for consumers and businesses, supporting its decision to launch an investigation into the sector in January.】

item.title: 口袋妖怪Go》制作商Niantic将以35亿美元的价格将游戏部门出售给沙特控股的Scopely公司
item.description: Niantic Labs 表示将以 35 亿美元的价格将其视频游戏部门出售给沙特阿拉伯拥有的 Scopely 公司，这家美国增强现实公司在未能重现 2016 年大热游戏 "Pokemon Go "的成功之后，将重点转向了地理空间技术。【原文：Niantic Labs said it would sell its video-game division to Saudi Arabia-owned Scopely for $3.5 billion, as the U.S. augmented reality firm shifts focus to geospatial technology after failing to recreate the success of its 2016 smash hit "Pokemon Go."】

item.title: 口袋妖怪Go》制作商Niantic将以35亿美元的价格将游戏部门出售给沙特控股的Scopely公司
item.description: Niantic Labs 表示将以 35 亿美元的价格将其视频游戏部门出售给沙特阿拉伯拥有的 Scopely 公司，这家美国增强现实公司在未能重现 2016 年大热游戏 "Pokemon Go "的成功之后，将重点转向了地理空间技术。【原文：Niantic Labs said it would sell its video-game division to Saudi Arabia-owned Scopely for $3.5 billion, as the U.S. augmented reality firm shifts focus to geospatial technology after failing to recreate the success of its 2016 smash hit "Pokemon Go."】
